body_html:
Thank you for your question.
It would depend if this Grid LSTM or standard LSTM....

There is the initial transformation:
S= W . Input
Input= [Xt, ht]

(ht_o, mt_o) = LSTM(ht, mt, W)

My questions is :

  1. Can TensorFlow RNN accept this Input Tensor rank (3 to 5) ?
    (Nsample, m, 1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)

  2. The input can be transformed into sub-space through W.....
    But, in order to keep the initial input rank, state dimension would be:
    ht: (m2, d2) hidden state
    mt: (m2, d2) memory cell

   (Usually, ht is  vector  of size d   for standard LSTM).

   Is this feasible ?

body:
Thank you for your question.
It would depend if this Grid LSTM or standard LSTM....

There is the initial transformation:
    S= W . Input
         Input= [Xt, ht]

```
(ht_o, mt_o) = LSTM(ht, mt, W)
```

My questions is :  
 1) Can TensorFlow RNN accept this Input Tensor rank (3 to 5) ?
                   (Nsample, m, 1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)

 2) The input can be transformed into sub-space through W.....
      But, in order to keep the initial input rank, state dimension would be:
                      ht:  (m2,  d2)     hidden state
                      mt:  (m2, d2)     memory cell

```
   (Usually, ht is  vector  of size d   for standard LSTM).

   Is this feasible ?
```
